Layered double hydroxides (LDHs) are found among clay minerals or as synthesized materials, which are composed of positively charged brucite-like layers and anions between these layers. Extensive studies show that LDHs have important applications in catalysis [ 1, 2, 3, 4], biomedical science [ 5, 6], energy science [ 7, 8], etc. Generally, the chemical formula of LDHs can be written as [M 2+ 1− x M 3+

The Li-Al LDHs (LiAl-X- mH 2O), in which the octahedral vacancies of the Al(OH) 3 layers are completely occupied by monovalent Li + cations [ 12, 13, 14, 15], are the only known cases of M +-M 3+ LDHs to date.
